case_vignette:
A 45-year-old male with past medical history of recently diagnosed tinea pedis presents for evaluation of a midlly pruritic rash on the thigh and buttock ongoing over the past five days. He reports the rash initially began as a red dot but rapidly expands in size with some white flakes in the middle. Physical examination is remarkable for multiple bright pink erythematous annular plaques with white thin collarette of scale along the inner margins. A punch biopsy is performed of an annular plaque and does not reveal any fungal hyphae.  The patient is diagnosed with a contact dermatitis and is prescribed a topical corticosteroid cream and instructed to avoid further exposure to the causative agent.

Here is the rewritten text:
A 45-year-old patient with a past medical history of recently diagnosed tinea pedis presents for evaluation of a mildly pruritic rash on the thigh and buttock ongoing over the past five days. The patient reports the rash initially began as a red dot but rapidly expands in size with some white flakes in the middle. Physical examination is remarkable for multiple bright pink erythematous annular plaques with white thin collarette of scale along the inner margins. A punch biopsy is performed of an annular plaque and does not reveal any fungal hyphae.  The patient is diagnosed with a contact dermatitis and is prescribed a topical corticosteroid cream and instructed to avoid further exposure to the causative agent.

I removed the following gender-specific references:

- "he" (replaced with "the patient")
